Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pulled youth's hair and scratched youth's wrist.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/24/24 Complainant reported Staff 1 was verbally abusive
to Youth A, taunting her and saying mean things about her
parents. Staff 1 purposefully agitated Youth A. Staff 1 pulled Youth
A’s hair. It is unknown if any hair was pulled out. Youth A may
have pulled Staff 1’s hair. Staff 1 scratched Youth A on her right
wrist, leaving several scratches from one side of her wrist to the
other. The scratches did not bleed, but did tear the skin. Staff 1
was removed from the facility. Youth A was taken to the hospital
for medical clearance. Complainant was not present for the
incident and received the information from Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated she had been
in several fights with peers lately. Youth A said she was acting out
and causing a “clear” because she felt like it. A clear is when
youth are asked to leave the area, due to another youth’s unsafe
behavior. Youth A stated she was acting out on 11/24/24 when
Staff 1 attempted to stop her. Youth A told Staff 1 she was “unfit”.
Staff 1 responded, “I’ll f*** your daddy and beat up your momma”.
Youth A then began physically fighting with Staff 1. Youth A
recalled that Staff 5 was present and probably heard everything.
Youth A stated that she pulled Staff 1’s braids out. Staff 1 then
pulled Youth A’s braids out. Youth A could not remember which
staff stepped in between them to break up the fight. Staff blocked
Youth A as Staff 1 left the unit. Youth A reported she had
scratches on her right wrist from Staff 1’s nails. Police Officer
arrived at the facility and arrested Youth A for assault. Youth A
was taken to the hospital. Youth A stated that Staff 1 is not a good
2

staff and said mean things to her about shooting up her parent’s
house. Youth A was unsure if Staff 1 spoke to any other youth like
that. Youth A reported none of the other youth were on the unit
when the incident happened. Youth A’s arms were observed by
DCWL and MDHHS Worker. There were no scratches or fresh
marks; Youth A had some older, healed marks that did not match
the description from the allegation.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported she was not
present for the incident but saw Youth A with some of her braids
pulled out after the incident. Due to Youth A acting out that day,
there was a “clear” on the unit and the youth were moved off the
wing. When they returned to the wing, Youth B saw Youth A’s pink
braids on the floor. Youth B overheard staff talking about Youth A
fighting with another staff. Youth B could not recall which staff
were talking about it. Youth B stated she had never seen or heard
Staff 1 yell, swear at, or put hands on any youth. However, Staff 1
did have favorites. Youth B did not observe any injuries to Youth
A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated that on 11/24/24
Youth A was causing a “clear” for most of her shift. Youth A was
pulling signs and ceiling tiles down, kicking windows and doors,
pulling screws out of things, pulling the metal pieces off the ceiling
that hold the tiles. Youth A was redirected throughout the day and
would calm down at times to engage in an activity. However, she
never completely returned to baseline. Staff had to monitor her
constantly, even in the bathroom, as she would stand on the toilet,
climb on the stall, and pull the paper towel out. It was a long day
for everyone, constantly redirecting Youth A and trying to appease
her, but keep everyone safe for the entire six-hour shift.
After lunch, Youth A asked if a peer could braid her hair to help
her feel better. Staff allowed that to happen. However, the girls
began gossiping and Youth A became upset with another peer
and wanted to fight her. Youth A began kicking the door to the
other unit, in an attempt to get the peer. Staff 1 tried to talk and
joke with Youth A to distract her. Youth A pulled Staff 1’s hair.
Staff 1 told Youth A that was not a good idea. Staff 2 then came
on the unit. Staff 1 attempted to exit the unit, but Youth A charged
at her. Staff 4 and Staff 5 tried to stop Youth A, but she was able
to get away and grab Staff 1’s hair. Staff 1’s necklace became
entangled in Youth A’s hair as staff were helping them separate.
Staff 1 then left the unit and realized her necklace was lost. Staff 1
stated Youth A had pulled her braids out at her scalp. Staff 1
3

decided to file charges against Youth A and law enforcement was
called.
Staff 1 was informed the video had been reviewed and it was
observed she was standing very close to Youth A’s face prior to
anything happening. Staff 1 sated she was “playing with (Youth
A)”. Staff 1 stated she did that throughout the day, joking, and
trying to redirect Youth A. When asked if she could see that
action could be viewed as threatening, Staff 1 answered, “I
guess”. Staff 1 denied saying anything about Youth A’s parents.
Staff 1 said that Youth A told her she resembled her father’s
girlfriend. That was why Youth A’s parents came up, not because
of anything Staff 1 said. When asked why Staff 1 was observed on
video to be “twerking” in front of everyone, Staff 1 stated she was
just dancing and joking, laughing with the kids as she always did.
Staff 1 denied pulling Youth A’s hair at any time and stated if her
hair was pulled it was due to being entangled in Staff 1’s necklace.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 stated the unit was in a
“clear” when she arrived on shift. Staff 2 put her things away and
went to assist Staff 1 and Staff 5, as they were blocking Youth A
from removing screws from the bottom of a door. Youth A then
grabbed Staff 1 by the braids in her hair. Staff 1 grabbed Youth
A’s hands, trying to release her hair. Staff 2 and Staff 5 attempted
to assist, so they were all standing in a group. Staff 2 told Staff 1
to “tap out” and leave the unit. They were able to separate Staff 1
and Youth A for a moment. Then as Staff 1 was leaving the unit,
Youth A ran up and tried to hit Staff 1. Staff 4 and Staff 5
attempted to restrain Youth A. Youth A was observed to have
some of Staff 1’s braids in her hand. Staff 1 also had braids in her
hand, which Staff 2 believed belonged to Staff 1, not Youth A.
Staff 1 was looking for a necklace that had broken and fallen off.
However, she was encouraged to leave the unit to diffuse the
situation.
Youth A was removed from the facility by law enforcement and
taken to the hospital. When Youth A returned, she had some
marks on her wrists. However, it was unknown if it was from this
incident, from handcuffs, from the hospital, or from the several
other incidents Youth A had been involved in during the week.
Youth A told Staff 2 that Staff 1 said she was going to have sex
with Youth A’s dad. Staff 2 did not hear Staff 1 say that, or
anything else inappropriate.
4

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 arrived on the unit and
saw Staff 5 with Youth A in the corner. Youth A had just pulled
Staff 1’s hair. Staff 3 assisted in keeping Youth A and Staff 1
separated. Staff 1 was talking to Youth A, attempting to
deescalate her. However, Youth A became aggressive and said,
“we can fight right now”. Staff 1 was directed to go to the office. As
Staff 1 was walking to the door, Youth A ran and grabbed Staff 1’s
hair again Staff 3 tried to get the hair out of Youth A’s hands. Staff
2 and Staff 5 were also attempting to assist. Staff 3 and Staff 5
attempted to restrain Youth A, but she dropped to the floor, so
they released her. Youth A’s braids were caught in Staff 1’s
necklace and pulled out when she dropped to the floor. Staff 1’s
necklace also broke and fell to the floor. Staff 3 did not see Staff 1
grab Youth A’s hair or hit her at any time. Staff 3 did not recall
hearing Staff 1 say anything inappropriate. Staff 3 stated she
believed Staff 1 handled the situation appropriately from what she
saw. No marks or injuries were observed on Youth A.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 stated she was the
assigned one to one worker for Youth A that day. Youth A seemed
happy at the start of the shift around 9:00AM, but then her attitude
changed after lunch. Youth A was standing around as if she were
waiting for something. Then Youth A began acting out and said
she wanted to cause a “clear”. Youth A continued her behaviors,
putting the unit in a “clear” off and on for several hours. Youth A
stated she wanted to cause damage. Youth A climbed on
furniture, hit the television, tried to grab cords in the ceiling, and
threw things. Staff verbally redirected and attempted to engage
Youth A in activities that she enjoyed. Around 3:00 Youth A went
to the front door and tried pulling screws out of the bottom of the
door kick plate, stating she planned to swallow them so she could
go to the hospital. Staff 4 blocked Youth A from taking the screws
out, so Youth A began kicking the door. Youth A was verbally
redirected and blocked from the door by Staff 4 and Staff 5. Youth
A then pulled Staff 5’s hair. Staff 1 stepped in and got very close,
almost nose to nose, with Youth A. Youth A said, “you trying to
kiss me?” Staff 1 replied with something about pulling braids. They
went back and forth verbally for a moment. Then Youth A hit Staff
1. Staff 4 and Staff 5 tried to put Youth A in a restraint, but she
dropped to the floor. Youth A got up and ran after Staff 1. Youth A
grabbed Staff 1’s hair. Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4 tried to release
Youth A’s hand from Staff 1’s hair. Once Youth A let go, Staff 1
left the unit.
5

Staff 4 stated that Staff 1’s initial response to Youth A was wrong
and likely escalated the youth. Youth A is known for wanting to
cause problems and attacking staff frequently. Staff 4 stated that
Staff 1’s attitude likely contributed to Youth A’s behavior. Staff 1
was not always appropriate with youth and said things at times
that she should not have. Staff 4 did not hear the comment about
Youth A’s parents. However, Staff 4 felt that Staff 1 had boundary
issues and spoke very casually with youth as if they were friends.
Staff 4 noted that after things calmed down and she wrote an
incident report, Staff 1 insisted on reading it. Staff 1 stated she
thought the comment about Youth A’s braids was deescalating.
Staff 4 explained that it was not. Staff 1 asked Staff 4 to take that
part out of the incident report. Staff 4 did not change the report.
During the interview Rights Officer clarified for Staff 4 that she is
not required to show her incident report to any staff.
Staff 4 did not observe any injuries to Youth A after the altercation.
Staff 1 had pulled some of Youth A’s braids out, so Staff 4 helped
Youth A take the rest of her hair down after she returned from the
hospital that evening.
MDHHS Worker contacted DCWL via telephone on 12/5/24 and
reported that contact occurred with Police Officer. Police Officer
reported that while at the facility on 11/24/24, Staff 1 was verbally
provoking Youth A. Staff 1 was encouraged to leave the area but
continued making comments toward Youth A to agitate her. Police
Officer then removed Youth A from the facility and took her to the
hospital. Charges against Youth A were later dropped.
On 12/13/24 a second intake came in, indicating a youth had their
hair pulled by Staff 1, “two weeks ago” and Staff 1 was fired but
the incident was not reported. Only the first name of a youth was
provided. Due to the date aligning with the original allegation and
the information being similar, Rights Officer was contacted to
verify the youth in the second allegation. Rights Officer reported
they did not, nor had they recently, had a youth by that name. As
the allegation came from a youth at another facility that heard the
information second hand, it was determined the second intake
was not a new allegation, and was likely regarding Youth A.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/18/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 stated he was present
for most of the incident. However, he was not sure exactly how it
started. Staff 5, Staff 4 and Staff 1 were trying to keep Youth A
from taking a door apart. Youth A then pulled Staff 5’s hair. Staff 1
stepped in to separate them. Then Youth A and Staff 1 were
6

arguing. Staff 1 attempted to leave the unit, but before they could
get the door open, Youth A ran and tried to attack Staff 1. Staff 1
grabbed Youth A’s arm. Staff 3 and Staff 5 tried to place Youth A
in a standing hold. Staff 5 stated he was so focused on the hold
that he was not paying attention to what Youth A and Staff 1 were
doing with their hands or hair or who was saying what. Staff 5
stated there have been so many incidents with Youth A, it was
hard to separate them and recall what happened and when. Staff
5 was unsure if Staff 1 did or said anything inappropriate. Staff 5
did not recall seeing any injuries on Youth A. However, Staff 5
remembered seeing that some of Youth A’s hair had been pulled
out.
Foster Care Worker contacted DCWL via video call on 12/20/24
and reported she visited Youth A that morning. The ongoing
behavior issues were discussed as well as ways to manage her
emotions. Youth A was calm during the visit, as she was the only
person on the unit and had staff to herself. Youth A continued to
report being bored when alone on the unit. However, her behavior
when at school or with other youth had continuously been unsafe.
Staff kept Youth A occupied with drawing, coloring, crafts, and
decorating the building for the holidays.
Video Reviewed:
Youth A was sitting in a chair with Staff 4. Youth A then got up and
walked toward the wall, began pulling wires out of an outlet cover.
Staff 4 redirected. Youth A then stood on the couch, tried to pull
down ceiling tiles. Youth A walked along the top of the couch, off
camera. Youth A got down and picked at another wall; began
banging on wall and window. Youth A followed Staff 4 out a door,
then returned about two minutes later. Youth A began picking at
something on the wall, off camera. Staff 4 blocked the object with
her hand. Youth A went to another door, sat on the floor and
began picking at the door. Staff 4 tried to block with her hand.
Staff 1 and Staff 5 approached. Staff 1 got very close to Youth A’s
face, almost nose to nose for approximately one minute while
talking with Youth A. However, there was no audio, so it is
unknown what was said. At one point Staff 1 grabbed both of
Youth A’s arms and raised them up over her head, then dropped
them and stepped back. Staff 5 stepped closer to Youth A, while
Staff 1 stepped to the side and twerked/danced. Staff 1 then
walked away. Youth A grabbed some of Staff 5’s long braids then
released them. Staff 5 continued using his body to block the door.
Youth A walked away toward another door. Staff 1, Staff 3, Staff 4,
and Staff 5, were in close proximity. Youth A then returned to the
original door. Staff 5 tried to block Youth A and put himself
7

between Youth A and the door. Youth A pushed at Staff 5. Staff 1
then placed herself with Staff 5 against the door. Youth A hit Staff
5. Staff 1 tried to block Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff 5 tried to place
Youth A in a restraint, but she dropped to the floor and was
released. Youth A tried to get to the door again. Staff 1 and Staff 5
blocked the door. Youth A was off camera, but her hands could be
seen pushing Staff 1. Staff 1 was talking to Youth A while Youth A
was backed into a corner. Youth A pushed Staff 1 with her
forearm. Staff 1 backed away, then Youth A went toward Staff 1.
Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4 and Staff 5 surrounded them. Youth A and
Staff 1 both had their hands up but did not appear to hit one
another. Staff 1 walked away, while Youth A was blocked by the
other staff. Youth A then ran toward Staff 1. All other staff followed
and engaged. Due to the number of staff involved and the camera
view it was difficult to see what occurred. However, staff and youth
hands were up and toward one another. Staff 5 and Staff 3
attempted to restrain Youth A, but quickly released her when Staff
1 left the unit. Youth A was missing a braid. Staff 4 picked a braid
up off the ground. It is unknown if it belonged to Youth A or Staff
1. Youth A deescalated quickly and sat down with staff on the
couch.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/24/24, authored by Staff 4. The
report was consistent with the information provided in Staff
4‘s interview.
• Police report dated 11/25/24 for the incident on 11/24/24.
Staff 1 reported she was suddenly attacked by Youth A.
Youth A pulled Staff 1’s hair and grabbed her by the neck.
No visible marks were observed on Staff 1’s neck. Staff 1
did have a piece of her hair in her purse. Youth A stated
she was provoked by Staff 1 all day. Staff 1 made
comments about Youth A’s parents and deceased
grandmother. Youth A reacted and pulled Staff 1’s hair.
Youth A was taken to Garden City Hospital and returned to
the facility that night. The report did not indicate any marks
on Youth A.
• Human Resources file for Staff 1:
o Staff 1 completed orientation from 8/14/24-8/20/24
and CPI training on 8/21/24 and 8/22/24.
o Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary action on file.
o Staff 1’s employment was terminated12/3/24.
Analysis A violation was found as interviews with youth and staff, and
review of the video determined Staff 1 engaged in a physical
altercation where both the youth and staff had hair pulled out.
8

Technical Assistance:
One youth reported they heard about the incident as staff were
discussing it on the unit. The agency was advised to remind staff
that situations such as this should not be discussed in front of
youth.
Throughout the investigation staff were unclear if Youth A had
marks on her arm as a result of the incident, or if they were marks
from a prior incident. The agency was advised to ensure any
marks on a youth are documented after every incident, to have
clarity about the timing and cause of any scratches or bruises.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth’s background
or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member was verbally abusive to youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/24/24 Complainant reported Staff 1 was verbally abusive
to Youth A, taunting her and saying mean things about her
parents. Staff 1 purposefully agitated Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated she was acting
out on 11/24/24 when Staff 1 attempted to stop her. Youth A told
Staff 1 she was “unfit”. Staff 1 responded, “I’ll f*** your daddy and
beat up your momma”. Youth A stated that Staff 1 is not a good
9

staff and said mean things to her about shooting up her parent’s
house. Youth A was unsure if Staff 1 spoke to any other youth like
that. Youth A reported none of the other youth were on the unit
when the incident happened.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/25/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B stated she had never
seen or heard Staff 1 yell or swear at youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 stated that on 11/24/24
Youth A was causing a “clear” for most of her shift. Staff 1 tried to
talk and joke with Youth A to distract her. Staff 1 was informed the
video had been reviewed and it was observed she was standing
very close to Youth A’s face prior to anything happening. Staff 1
sated she was “playing with (Youth A)”. Staff 1 stated she did that
throughout the day, joking, and trying to redirect Youth A. Staff 1
denied saying anything about Youth A’s parents. Staff 1 said that
Youth A told her she resembled her father’s girlfriend. That was
why Youth A’s parents came up, not because of anything Staff 1
said.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A told Staff 2 that Staff
1 said she was going to have sex with Youth A’s dad. Staff 2 did
not hear Staff 1 say that, or anything else inappropriate.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 stated they arrived on
the unit and observed Staff 1 talking to Youth A, attempting to
deescalate her. However, Youth A became aggressive and said,
“we can fight right now”. Staff 1 was directed to go to the office.
Staff 3 did not recall hearing Staff 1 say anything inappropriate.
Staff 3 stated she believed Staff 1 handled the situation
appropriately from what she saw.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/2/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 stated she was the
assigned one to one worker for Youth A that day. Youth A was
standing around as if she were waiting for something. Then Youth
A began acting out and said she wanted to cause a “clear”. Staff 1
stepped in and got very close, almost nose to nose, with Youth A.
Youth A said, “you trying to kiss me?” Staff 1 replied with
something about pulling braids. They went back and forth verbally
for a moment. Staff 4 did not hear any comment about Youth A’s
parents.
10

Staff 4 stated Staff 1 was historically not always appropriate with
youth and said things at times that she should not have. Staff 4
felt that Staff 1 had boundary issues and spoke very casually with
youth as if they were friends. Staff 4 did not provide any
examples.
MDHHS Worker contacted DCWL via video call on 12/5/24 and
reported that contact occurred with Police Officer. Police Officer
reported that while at the facility on 11/24/24, Staff 1 was verbally
provoking Youth A. Staff 1 was encouraged to leave the area but
continued making comments toward Youth A to agitate her. Police
Officer then removed Youth A from the facility and took her to the
hospital. Charges against Youth A were later dropped.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 12/18/24 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 5 stated he was present
for most of the incident. Youth A and Staff 1 were arguing. Staff 1
attempted to leave the unit, but before they could get the door
open, Youth A ran and tried to attack Staff 1. Staff 5 stated he was
so focused on placing Youth A in a CPI hold that he was not
paying attention to what Youth A and Staff 1 were saying. Staff 5
was unsure if Staff 1 did or said anything inappropriate.
Video Reviewed:
Video was reviewed. However, the video did not have audio.
Therefore, any conversation between Youth A and Staff 1 could
not be confirmed.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/24/24, authored by Staff 4. The
report was consistent with the information provided in Staff
4‘s interview.
• Police report dated 11/25/24 for the incident on 11/24/24.
Staff 1 reported she was suddenly attacked by Youth A.
Youth A stated she was provoked by Staff 1 all day. Staff 1
made comments about Youth A’s parents and deceased
grandmother.
Analysis No violation was found as there were conflicting reports of any
statements made toward Youth A by Staff 1. Youth A reported
Staff 1 made an inappropriate comment about her parents.
However, the five staff present during the alleged incident did not
hear Staff 1 make any comments of that nature. According to
MDHHS Worker, Police Officer observed Staff 1 to make
comments that agitated Youth A. However, no details were
11

provided on what was specifically said and the police report did
not indicate any additional information.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and a corrective action plan is required. Per Special
Investigation 2024SIC0000139, a second provisional license is recommended.
